isis.stitle: PRE-DELIVERY/QUALITY INSPECTION INSTRUCTION MANUAL FOR CF 500 and CF 600 MODELS - CF 500 and CF 600 MODEL INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS (REPORT S00102)

svcproc.title: CF 500 and CF 600 MODEL INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS (REPORT S00102)
svcproc.para: 1. Prepare vehicle for PDI inspection - wheel chocks

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, chock the wheels and turn the engine off.

item.para: PDI Inspection area should take place in a well-lit location with a level floor.
Install wheel chocks.
Turn OFF key.
On air brake vehicles, release parking brake.
Indicate on Inspection Report the vehicle Model, Plant, PDI Facility, VIN, Service Invoice No., and Customer.

svcproc.para: 2. Connect to Midtronics Smart Charger and begin charging - 2 hours minimum
For 12V Parallel Systems

item.para: Open battery box.
Connect battery charger to positive and negative terminals of battery pack in any convenient position.
Turn charger ON at 12V automatic high rate of charge. Watch for Incorrect Hook-Up warning.

svcproc.para: 3. Install loose components shipped with the vehicle

item.para: These include tailpipes, cargo nets, and any other mounted component not installed by the plant but shipped with the vehicle.
This labor is not part of the PDI but is to be collected from the Sales Department.

svcproc.para: 4. Routing and clipping under vehicle - secure, meets specifications

item.para: All cables, hoses, and wires should be:
Well supported every 24" or less.
Free from tension
5" from any heat source unless shielded
3" from any heat source if shielded
Clear from any rub or pinch point
Free from crimping
Should NOT block access to any fluid fill point
Compressor discharge line should be free from any low points, or "traps"
Items included in this check:
Electrical wiring harnesses
Battery cables
Fuel hoses
Coolant / heater hoses
Power steering hoses
Transmission cooler lines
Hydraulic brake hoses
Add-on hydraulic hosing
Listen for audible air leaks.
There should be no audible air leaks.
If problems are found with routing and clipping or air leaks, correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 5. Drive Axle Oil Level - full (ALL applicable drive axles)

item.para: Verify that oil level is filled level with fill port. Add fluid as needed.
Verify that drain plug is snug and leak-free.

svcproc.para: 6. Rearmost Drive Shaft U-Joints - phasing with next shaft, retorque

item.para: Verify that forward u-joint on rearmost shaft is phased like the forward joint on the second shaft from the rear.
Retorque U-joint connections to assure proper reassembly after delivery.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 7. Center Bearing Alignment - square and tight - all center bearings

item.para: Verify that center bearing isolator is not out of carrier alignment.
Verify that center bearing assembly mounting bolts are tight.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 8. Exhaust System - secure, positioned, tailpipe extends beyond body

item.para: Exhaust system should be securely mounted to frame.
Exhaust system joints should be tight and leak free. Look for evidence of leakage such as soot or slobber around the joints.
Exhaust system sensors, cables, tubes, and hoses should be tension free and should not rub any object.
Exhaust tailpipe must extend beyond any coachwork.
Exhaust tailpipe must not contact mudflaps or other non-exhaust components.
Exhaust tailpipe must not exit within 12" laterally from any fuel fill point.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 9. Cotter keys / lock tabs present, properly spread - steering / brakes/clutch

item.para: Replace missing or damaged cotter keys or lock tabs.

svcproc.para: 10. Starter / Ground Connections - tight, secure, greased

item.para: Inspect cable end tightness. Connections should be tight and coated with dielectric grease.
Cable ends make no contact with other vehicle hardware.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 11. Lubricate chassis - all grease zerks

item.para: Lubricate all grease zerks

svcproc.para: 12. Axle Spring U-bolts - retorque

item.para: Re-torque all spring u-bolts to 260 - 300 lbf-ft (353 - 407 Nm).

svcproc.para: 13. Tires - proper inflation, valve stem caps are tight

item.para: Tire pressure should be checked with a pressure gauge.
Tires may come from the vendor inflated above the maximum pressure indicated on the sidewall.
If tires are inflated beyond the maximum pressure indicated on the sidewall, they should be left at that pressure.
Rear tires should be inflated to 90 +/- 5 psi, at minimum.
Front tires should be inflated to the maximum pressure indicated on the sidewall, at minimum.
Tire pressure should be equal for all tires on an axle.
Correct as needed.
Re-install valve stem caps properly.

svcproc.para: 14. Wheel Lug Nuts - retorque

item.para: Re-torque all wheel nuts following the proper tightening sequence to 140 - 160 lbf-ft (190 - 217 Nm).

svcproc.para: 15. Axle Flange Bolts - retorque

item.para: Make sure new gaskets have been installed on each axle removed by the transport carrier.
Tighten the bolts in a star pattern to 96 - 116 lbf-ft (130 - 157 Nm) to ensure that axle flanges are properly seated.

svcproc.para: 16. Cab Tilt / Assist / Latch/ Lockout Mechanisms - work properly

item.para: Cab should tilt smoothly, easily, quietly.
Cab lock-out should work properly.
First latch works properly - catch and release.
Third latch works properly - catch and release.
Mechanism latches cab firmly.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 17. Batteries/ Cables/ Cover - routing, tight, secured, greased, view eyes

item.para: Battery cable end connections should be tight and secure.
Battery cable end connections should be protected by a dielectric grease.
Cables are not kinked, crimped, pinched or rubbing when box moves.
Batteries should be securely fastened in box.
Battery view eyes should not be obscured by cables or mounting hardware.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 18. Steering Intermediate Shaft Pinch Bolts, Both ends - torqued off

item.para: Pinch bolts should be twisted off at steering gear box end of steering intermediate shaft.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 19. Turbo downpipe - secured, no contact with other hardware

item.para: Verify turbo to downpipe connection is secure and well positioned.
Downpipe makes no contact with other vehicle hardware.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 20. Engine compartment routing / clipping - secure, meets specifications

item.para: All cables, hoses, and wires should be:
Well supported every 24" or less.
Free from tension.
5" from any heat source unless shielded.
3" from any heat source if shielded.
Clear from any rub or pinch point.
Free from crimping.
Should NOT block access to any fluid fill point.
Items included in this check:
Electrical wiring harnesses.
Battery cables.
Air hoses.
Fuel hoses.
Coolant / heater hoses.
Power steering hoses.
Transmission cooler lines.
Hydraulic brake hoses.
Add-on hydraulic hosing.
Listen for audible air leaks.
There should be no audible air leaks.
If problems are found with routing and clipping or air leaks, correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 21. Engine compartment wire harness connections - seated / latched / tight

item.para: Verify all wire harness electrical connections are securely latched.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 22. Engine compartment hose clamps - tightness, position

item.para: Verify clamp orientation allows good access.
For hose clamps:
Aluminum pipe, re-tighten to 50 - 60 in-lb.
Steel pipe, re-tighten to 70 - 75 in-lb.

svcproc.para: 23. Engine Oil Level - between ADD and FULL marks

item.para: Vehicle should be parked on a level surface.
Engine oil level should register between half-full and full on dipstick. Add proper oil as needed to correct fluid level.

svcproc.para: 24. Washer Fluid Level

item.para: Washer fluid level should be half-full or higher. Add fluid as required.

svcproc.para: 25. Driver's Area - restraints, seat, controls, windows, mirrors, visors

item.para: Verify proper installation, condition, and operation of Driver's Area.
Included Items:
Restraints
Seat
Steering wheel
Controls
Windows
Mirror adjustment
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 26. Gauges and Dash Warning Lights - function properly
Multiplexed Systems

item.para: With engine off and key in RUN position, gauges will self test with a full clockwise sweep.
With engine off and key in RUN position, warning lights will illuminate.
If any gauge points to 6:00 position, data is out of range or no data is available. Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: Non-Multiplexed Systems

item.para: With engine off and key in RUN position, warning lights will illuminate.
With engine off and key in RUN position, gauges will self test.

svcproc.para: 27. Clear inactive fault codes

item.para: Hook up Electronic Service Tool (EST). Clear inactive fault codes.

svcproc.para: 28. Neutral Start - Cranks in Neutral, Park, or with clutch depressed only
Automatic Transmission

item.para: Select all gear ranges and turn key to START position. Starter MUST NOT ACTIVATE except in NEUTRAL or PARK position.
Start vehicle.

svcproc.para: Manual Transmission

item.para: Starter MUST NOT ACTIVATE except when clutch pedal is depressed.
Start vehicle.

svcproc.para: 29. Brake warning light, buzzer, motor, air system - function properly
Full Power Systems

item.para: With the key switch in the OFF position the park brake and brake pressure lights should be off. The system may have enough stored fluid pressure to apply the brakes without starting the motor. With the key switch in OFF position the motor should operate when the brake pedal is pressed. If it does not, apply and release the brakes until the motor starts, up to a maximum of 10 times. (If the motors do not start when pedal is pressed and key off there is most likely a problem with the brake light switch in the master cylinder, or there may be a communication problem with the ESC.)
Engage the park brake if it is not already set, and turn the key switch to ON. The park brake light must go ON.

The motor will operate until hydraulic pressure has been built in the accumulators. Brake pressure buzzer should sound and brake pressure light should stay on until approximately 1500 psi is built in accumulators.
Start the engine and let it run. The motors must turn off once cut-out pressure is reached. The park brake light will remain on since the park brake is still set.
Press the brake pedal and disengage the park brake. The park brake light must go off.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: Hydromax Systems

item.para: With the key switch in OFF position the park brake light should be off. The motor will operate when the brake pedal is pressed.
Engage the park brake and turn the key switch to ON. The light must go on. The motor should operate continuously.
Start the engine and let it run. The motor must turn off. The light will remain on since the park brake is still set.
Press the brake pedal and disengage the park brake. The light must go off.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: Air Brake Systems

item.para: With the key switch in the OFF position, the light must be off. The pressure should be below 55 psi. If necessary, apply and release the brakes until the system pressure drops below 55 psi.
Turn the key switch to the ON position. The light and buzzer must be on when the air pressure is below 55 psi.
Start the engine and let it run. The light and buzzer must go off once the air pressure in both systems reaches 76 psi.
Pressure Build
Pressure should build from 85 - 100 psi in 45 seconds.
Governor should cut out at 125 psi.
Pressure Bleed
Turn off engine, switch key to Accessory position, release service brake.
Air pressure should drop no more than 2 psi in one minute.
Apply and hold service brake.
Pressure should drop no more than 3 psi in one minute.
Low Pressure Alarm
Cycle service brake pedal to deplete air pressure.
Alarm must sound at 55 psi or higher.
Park Brake Application
Continue cycling service brake pedal to deplete air pressure
Park brake must apply at 20 psi or higher.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 30. Hydraulic Brake Fluid Level - proper level
Full Power System:

item.para: Turn key ON if engine is not already running. Pump brake pedal quickly five times. Wait until pump motors stop running.
Hydraulic brake fluid level should register between midpoint of MIN-MAX indicators and MAX indicator on transparent reservoir.
DO NOT OVERFILL. Reservoir can appear to be overfilled when key is in OFF position. Add appropriate fluid as needed to correct fluid level.

svcproc.para: HydroMax System:

item.para: The fluid level must be up to the bottom edge of the ring on each reservoir fill port.
DO NOT fill to the top of the reservoir.
Add appropriate fluid as needed to correct fluid level.

svcproc.para: 31. Automatic Transmission Fluid Level - between ADD and FULL marks

item.para: With vehicle running and in neutral or park position, check transmission fluid level. Fluid level should register between midpoint and Full mark in Cold range. Add appropriate fluid as needed to correct fluid level.

svcproc.para: 32. Power Steering Fluid Level - between ADD and FULL marks

item.para: Power steering fluid level should register between half-full and full range. Add appropriate fluid as needed to correct fluid level.

svcproc.para: 33. Engine Coolant Level - above half full in range, or above lower view eye

item.para: Coolant level should register between the midpoint of MIN-MAX indicators and MAX indicator on transparent surge tank.
Coolant freeze protection should be good to -40F/-40C.
Add proper coolant as needed.

svcproc.para: 34. Lights - exterior, instrument panel, interior

item.para: Check exterior lights and flashers.
Check interior lights.
Check dome lights.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 35. Horn and Windshield Wiper / Washer - function and adjustment

item.para: Verify operation of electric horn.
Verify operation of air horn.
Verify wipers work in all positions and do not contact each other or window frames.
Verify all washer nozzles' spray.

svcproc.para: 36. Park Brake Function - holds and rolls when it should

item.para: With Park Brake set and vehicle in drive gear, release service brake. Vehicle must not move. Park Brake indicator must be lit.
With Park Brake released, Park Brake light must not be visible.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 37. Gear Selector Function - each position selects correct gear
Automatic Transmission / Automatic Manual Transmission

item.para: Apply service brakes.
Verify that every gear is selected as indicated.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: Manual Transmission

item.para: Depress the clutch and apply the service brakes.
Verify that every gear is selected as indicated.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 38. Driver Controls - function properly

item.para: Check for proper function of systems:
Service brake
Accelerator
Steering
Retarder (Use caution when engaging retarder on slick road surfaces)
Cruise Control / Hand Throttle
Self-Canceling Turn Signal
Power Divider Lock
Differential Locks
Air Suspension Dump
Two Speed Axle
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 39. Gauges and Warning Lamps - function properly

item.para: Check for proper function of gauges:
Speedometer
Tachometer
Oil Pressure
Water Temperature
Voltmeter
Air Pressure
Fuel Level
Verify operation of all warning lamps
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 40. Climate controls - function properly

item.para: Check for proper operation of:
Heater
Defroster
A/C
Blower Fan
Adjustable Vents
Auxiliary Heaters
Auxiliary A/C
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 41. Engine, Transmission, Brakes, Steering - performance

item.para: The following characteristics should be considered:
Idle quality - smooth
Acceleration - smooth and powerful
Shifts - crisp but not harsh
NVH (Noise, Vibration, and Harshness) - smooth and quiet, no shuddering, squeaking, buzzing, hissing, whining
Braking / Retarder - smooth and powerful
Steering - Tight and straight, no pull or vibration
Oil Pressure - 25 - 40 psi, engine warm
Water Temperature - 235 F max, engine hot
Volts - 12.5 - 15.5V with engine at idle and low electrical accessory load.
Each parameter should be within an acceptable range per vehicle type and class.
Road test course should be nominally 4 miles and should include reverse operation and full-lock turns in right and left directions. Road test should include road speed of 50 mph or higher.

svcproc.para: 42. Steering Wheel Alignment
72 Tooth Spline

item.para: The 72 tooth spline steering wheel can be adjusted by +/- 5 degrees.
20 inch wheel - each tooth = 7/8 inch at the outside of the wheel.
18 inch wheel - each tooth = 3/4 inch at the outside of the wheel.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 36 Tooth Spline

item.para: The 36 tooth spline steering wheel can be adjusted by +/- 10 degrees.
20 inch wheel - each tooth = 1.75 inch at the outside of the wheel.
18 inch wheel - each tooth = 1.5 inch at the outside of the wheel.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 43. Hot Coolant Level - above half full in range, or above lower view eye

item.para: Coolant level should register between the midpoint of MIN-MAX indicators and MAX indicator on transparent surge tank.
Add proper coolant as needed.

svcproc.para: 44. Fluid or Air Leaks - Cab/Engine Compartment/Chassis - none

item.para: Check gaskets, seals, hoses, connections, and low points on housings on components that contain fluids.
Included components:
Engine
Transmission
Radiator
Transmission Cooler
Transmission Retarder
Drive Axle
Fuel Tank/ Fuel Delivery System
Chassis Power Steering lines
Hydraulic Brake tubing
Add-on Hydraulic equipment
Exhaust connections
Verify manual operation of drain valves if equipped with air tank(s).
Correct if needed.

svcproc.para: 45. Fault Codes - check

item.para: Check for fault codes.
Correct as needed.

svcproc.para: 46. Operator's Manual and other required documents are in vehicle
47. Install Instruction stickers on vehicle, found in Operator's Manual
48. PDI Location Code, Date - ADD to Vehicle Identification Label
49. Vehicle Certification Label - ADD - See NEW VEHICLE PROCESSING MANUAL
50. Pre-Delivery Service Identity Sticker (CTS-1122) - affix to windshield
51. COMMENTS - complete
52. Wash Vehicle - look for interior leaks
